recovery_overview: Goal: Boot a known-good U-Boot into RAM (via FEL) and carefully re-flash firmware.
1) Enter FEL mode on the board
2) Use sunxi-fel on PC to load u-boot-sunxi-with-spl.bin into RAM
3) Interact with U-Boot via UART (this bridge)
4) Restore firmware using SAFE chunked writes + verification
- If the board has write-size limitations, avoid large single write operations.
fel_entry: - Hold FEL/BOOT button (or short FEL pads)
- Try pressing FEL at power-on, not after.
uboot_ram_boot: You should be using a RAM boot method (does not write eMMC by itself).
Once U-Boot is running, you can use UART to check env + storage layout.
write_safety: If someone used PhoenixSuit and the board refuses large writes:
- DO NOT attempt one huge write to the eMMC.
- Prefer smaller chunks (ex: 4MB/8MB) with verify between chunks.
ums_best_option: Best Option: U-Boot UMS (USB Mass Storage)
your PC will see the eMMC as a USB drive.
Then you can image/restore using standard tools (dd / Win32DiskImager).
This is usually safer and more reliable than custom flash scripts.
gcode_help: Use !bp gcode to list groups and commands.
